name: paul
description: Paul's Greek vocabulary is rich in theological terminology, focusing on grace, faith, and the church body.

name: john
description: John uses a relatively simple but profound Greek vocabulary, centered on light, life, love, and the 'Logos'.

name: luke
description: Luke's Greek is among the most sophisticated in the New Testament, featuring medical nuances and historical precision.

name: peter
description: Peter's Greek is direct and earnest, often drawing on Old Testament themes of suffering and glory.

name: moses
description: The foundation of Biblical Hebrew. Moses' vocabulary spans creation, law, and the early history of Israel.

name: david
description: David's Hebrew is poetic and raw, capturing the full spectrum of human emotion in relationship with God.

name: solomon
description: Wisdom literature at its peak. Solomon's vocabulary focuses on discernment, the fear of the Lord, and human experience.
